info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:54AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Madison County through 630 AM EDT... At 554 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Greeneville, or 6 miles north of Hot Springs, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marshall, Hot Springs, Faust, Allenstand, Walnut, Wolf Ridge, Spring Creek and Luck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
